title: One of the rarest baseball cards is up for auction — and there are local connections
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: A rare T206 Honus Wagner baseball card with Massachusetts ties is up for auction until February 21.
Ken Goldin features the card on Netflix's "King of Collectibles", valuing it at over $4.75 million with premiums.
The card, kept by Morton Bernstein's family in California, was never graded and has remained unsold for 116 years.

title: Bruins G Jeremy Swayman set to make Olympic debut and start for Team USA vs. Denmark
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jeremy Swayman will start in net for Team USA against Denmark in the 2026 Winter Olympics.
Swayman, 27, helped Team USA win the 2025 IIHF World Championship with a 5-0 record and a shutout final.
Swayman's solid season includes a 22-12-3 record, a 2.92 GAA, and a .903 save percentage with the Bruins.

title: New England Aquarium IDs right whale found dead off Virginia
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: The New England Aquarium identified a dead right whale off Virginia as a 3-year-old female, Porcia's 2023 calf.
This marks the second right whale death in two weeks, both part of the ongoing North Atlantic Right Whale Unusual Mortality Event.
The species is critically endangered with roughly 380 individuals remaining; entanglements and vessel strikes are major threats.

title: Another child has died of the flu in Mass.
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts reports seven pediatric flu deaths this season, according to the Department of Public Health.
A total of 260 people have died from flu-related causes in Massachusetts, including 253 adults.
Flu activity strained hospitals in January; officials urge vaccinations as cases remain significant.

title: Mass. police department offers ‘Valentine’s Day Special’ for wanted exes
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Uxbridge Police Department encourages residents to report exes with outstanding warrants in a Valentine-themed Facebook post.
The post includes a flyer offering 'a ride with flashing lights' for exes, urging residents to share their whereabouts.
The initiative, similar to other states, received nearly 7,000 likes and over 400 comments on social media.

title: ‘We’ll see how it plays out’: Caleb Durbin, Marcelo Mayer each to practice at 2B, 3B to begin spring training
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Caleb Durbin and Marcelo Mayer will practice at both second and third base during Red Sox spring training.
Durbin, acquired from Milwaukee, and Mayer are top candidates for Red Sox's third base position this season.
Manager Alex Cora aims to finalize the starting infield soon to improve the team's defensive performance.

title: Report: Patriots QBs coach Ashton Grant to stay in New England, won’t take OC interviews
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Patriots QBs coach Ashton Grant will remain with New England, bypassing NFL offensive coordinator interviews, per ESPN's Adam Schefter.
Grant, from Manchester, Conn., played a critical role in QB Drake Maye's second-year development and near MVP-level performance.
Grant, a former college receiver, started his coaching career at Holy Cross and joined the Patriots in February 2025.

title: Brighton community raises $25k for flooded barbershop
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Brighton's Matt's Barber Shop flooded on Feb. 10 due to a burst pipe, causing significant damage.
A GoFundMe created by customer Dietrich Warner raised over $25,800 to help repair Matt's Barber Shop.
The barbershop is known as a community space and plans to reopen quickly with repairs underway.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Eternity' featuring Elizabeth Olsen, Miles Teller, and Callum Turner is now streaming on Apple TV.
'Dawson’s Creek', the teen drama starring James Van Der Beek, is available on Netflix, Hulu, and Tubi.
'Love Is Blind' Season 10, a dating show on Netflix, features couples meeting through a blind speed dating process.

title: Court says Mass. father’s battle over LGBTQ-friendly lessons excludes books on gender stereotypes
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Federal judge ruled two books do not fall under father's lawsuit against Lexington school district over LGBTQ-friendly lessons.
Judge Saylor specified that the lawsuit involves issues of marriage and sexuality, not gender stereotypes like sports or colors.
Parent Alan L.'s case involves opting out of lessons involving LGBTQ+ themes; court ruling centered on educational content definitions.
